landing.message: Thank you for signing up! This app will be where you report your medication. Reports are monitored by your treatment assistant.

coordinator.title: What is a Treatment Assistant?
coordinator.outro: Now please tell us a little about yourself.

password.title: Choose a new password for your account
password.noMatch: The password and confirmation do not match

notification.title: Notifications
notification.listHeader: This will allow us to send you
notification.header: The next step will ask you to turn on notifications
notification.one: Would you like to enable a daily reminder to take your medication?
notification.two: What time would you like to be reminded?

contactTracing.one: How many people do you live with?
contactTracing.two: How many have been tested for TB?
contactTracing.important: It is important that everyone you live with gets tested for TB.
contactTracing.explanation: Please let us know the status of your household so we can send you more information.

onboarding.endText: Thank you for your input, lets get started!
onboarding.activationError: There was an error activating your account. Contact your coordinator for help.

welcome.one: Thank you for signing up for Treatment Assistant!
welcome.two: We will now guide you through some of the core features

walkthrough.homescreen: We will start by showing you the homescreen
walkthrough.revisit: If you wish to revisit this walkthrough, you can find it on the information tab
walkthrough.exit: You can exit this walkthrough at any time by clicking the X in the top right
walkthrough.tasks: These are your daily tasks, you can click Start Report to begin logging your daily treatment
walkthrough.progressCard: The progress card shows you a quick preview of where you are at in your treatment.
walkthrough.reminders: Lastly, the reminders card allows you to change your daily medication reminder, and add reminders for appointments

navigation.text: The app has 4 main screens. To toggle between them select the icon in the bottom navigation bar

progress.header: We are now on the progress page
progress.three: Check the status of your photo submissions

walkthrough.weekCalendar: This is a preview of your last 5 reports. You can click to view your full calendar
walkthrough.calendar: Your full calendar gives a visual overview of your streak, and shows days you have missed in red
walkthrough.calendarBottom: You can click this area at the bottom to view details about your report
walkthrough.milestones: Back on the main progress page, you can manage your milestones here

messaging.header: Now we are on the messaging page
messaging.text: This page allows you to communicate with your assistant and other patients
messaging.one: Click here to directly and privately message your treatment assistant
messaging.two: Here you can chat publicly with other patients about your treatment. These discussions are organized by topic

outro.one: If you have any more questions check the information tab or reach out to your treatment assistant

reminders.title: Reminders
reminders.whatTime: What time would you like to recieve the reminder?
reminders.explanation: Enable to receive a reminder to take your medication every day at a specified time

home.purpose: Lets keep track of your medication and health!

completed.issue: We have recieved your issue and your assistant will be in touch soon

home.confirmAndSubmit: Please Confirm and Submit Your Report

chatReminder.body: Did you know you can chat anonymously with other patients?

photo.unable: Unable to submit? Tell us why

forcePasswordUpdate.title: Your password was reset, please create a new one

treatmentUpdates.3: La Tuberculosis Pulmonar se contagia cuando una persona enferma al toser, estornudar o al hablar elimina con la tos secreciones que contienen los bacilos que producen la enfermedad. Siempre tratar de toser en lugar bien ventilado, nunca cerrado, si es posible cubrirse la boca y/o utilizar barbijo.
treatmentUpdates.5: ¿Sabías que puedes chatear con otros pacientes en tratamiento anónimamente?
treatmentUpdates.7: Una de las drogas utilizadas, la Rifampicina, colorea la orina, saliva o lagrimas de color naranja o rojo. Esto es  normal. Las lentes de contacto pueden teñirse de manera irreversible.
treatmentUpdates.10: Estar en contacto frecuente y en lugares cerrados aumenta el riesgo de contagiarse. Las personas con las que vive o trabaja deben hacerse un control. ¡Cuando tosa, por favor cúbrase la boca con el pliegue del codo!
treatmentUpdates.14: Las drogas utilizadas en el tratamiento deben tomarse en ayunas con agua, ya que con los alimentos, sobre todo si contienen abundantes azúcares (por ejemplo yogurt) y harinas, la acción disminuye en forma importante (25-60%)
treatmentUpdates.21: La Tuberculosis Pulmonar no se contagia al dar la mano, compartir vasos o platos. Solo el contagio se produce al toser, estornudar o al hablar. Recordar que ¡La Tuberculosis se cura!
treatmentUpdates.24: Por la acción rápida de las drogas una persona enferma a los pocos días (entre 15 a 20 días) deja de contagiar. Esto lo determina el médico mediante un estudio de catarro.
treatmentUpdates.28: Dejar de contagiar no es igual a curación. Para que la Tuberculosis Pulmonar se cure debo cumplir con al menos 6 meses de tratamiento.
treatmentUpdates.31: Las drogas utilizadas en el tratamiento de la Tuberculosis pueden producir vómitos, picazón, pérdida del apetito, erupciones en la piel, disminución en la visión. Recordar que la presencia de estos efectos deberá consultarse con el servicio tratante, para evaluar la severidad de la misma.
treatmentUpdates.35: Los síntomas como fiebre, sudores nocturnos, tos y catarro, pueden persistir durante los primeros días del tratamiento. Recordar que hay que continuar con el tratamiento!
treatmentUpdates.38: Por la acción de los medicamentos la piel puede estar más sensible al sol. Tratar de no exponerse al sol. Recordar que lo importante es el cumplimiento del tratamiento.
treatmentUpdates.42: La alimentación puede incluir todos los componentes como pan, pastas, harinas, grasas, proteínas, fibra, fruta y verduras.
treatmentUpdates.46: Para controlar que las drogas antituberculosas utilizadas lo están curando, es necesario hacer controles mínimos del catarro. Recordar que los controles son importantes en los primeros meses del tratamiento cuando aún puede tener síntomas.
treatmentUpdates.50: Sabemos que, lamentablemente, la persona enferma puede sufrir actos de discriminación. Esto se debe al miedo y al desconocimiento. Creemos que la información y la difusión son la manera de desterrar estos prejuicios. Todos podemos enfermar.
treatmentUpdates.54: Las drogas utilizadas en el tratamiento de la Tuberculosis son 100% efectivas y curan al paciente enfermo. Si el tratamiento no se cumple hace que la bacteria se vuelva resistente a las drogas perdiendo así su esta efectividad.
treatmentUpdates.58: El control del catarro especialmente en los 2 primeros meses del tratamiento, permite saber si una persona aún sigue contagiando. Con estos controles si el catarro ya es negativo puedeo volver al trabajo, a pesar que debeo continuar con el tratamiento durante con el tratamiento los 6 meses. Adelante!
treatmentUpdates.62: Después del segundo mes el tratamiento es más sencillo con menor cantidad de medicación. Es importante continuar con todos los controles y examen del catarro para saber si las drogas me sirven para curarme.
treatmentUpdates.70: Ante cualquier complicación, el personal de salud de su lugar de atención puede controlar el tratamiento. Recordar que la única manera de prevenir en Tuberculosis es CURAR a todos los pacientes.
treatmentUpdates.80: Un tratamiento exitoso depende del cumplimiento de todas las tomas de la medicación. Tratar de respetar los horarios.
treatmentUpdates.90: La mejoría de los síntomas no es lo mismo que curación. Curar significa que hay que continuar habitualmente con un tratamiento 6 meses. Adelante!
treatmentUpdates.141: Let us know how we are doing! Someone from the study might reach out to you and ask about your experience with the app. We also have a survey that is available on the homepage. Thanks!

mayTestStripUpdate.title: Important Update
mayTestStripUpdate.subtitle: New test strip instructions
mayTestStripUpdate.body: The instructions for the test strips have changed, please review them before completing your next test.

exitInterviewAlert.title: Feedback
exitInterviewAlert.intro: You are almost done with treatment, great work!
exitInterviewAlert.ask: To gather feedback, a member of the study team might call you after you have finished using the app.
exitInterviewAlert.survey: We also have a short survey on your home screen.

dashboard.reportsVsRequests: Daily Reports Submitted / Total Active Number of Patients
dashboard.photosVsRequests: Daily Photos Submitted / Number of Requests

archive.explanation: If the patient has completed thier time using the application, fill in their last day, and click the button below to archive them. They will no longer appear in the lists of tasks, but their profile can be accessed from the cohort tab.
archive.warningShort: This patient has been archived and can no longer report
archive.warningLong: This patient has been archived and will no longer show up in your tasks. If you need to undo this action please contact study staff for technical support.

patientSide.subtitle: We know completing treatment is not easy, and you did an excellent job. If you have any questions your assistant will be there to support you.
patientSide.details: You do not need to report anymore, but feel free to use the other resources in the app.
patientSide.survey: If you have not yet done so, please complete this survey to let us know about your experience using the application.
patientSide.statusChange: Your study status has changed and you can no longer report. Please contact your assistant for more details.

archive.surveyText: Please send this link to the patient so they can tell us about their experience.

householdTesting.title: Household testing
householdTesting.reachOut: Not all of your contacts have been tested yet, please reach out to your treatment assistant for more information and recommendations.
householdTesting.completed: Great job ensuring the health of those with whom you live.

missedPhotoDetails.future: In the future please submit your test on the day it is requested so we can see your treatment progress.
missedPhotoDetails.requestedOn: Submitting for the request sent on
missedPhotoDetails.notRequired: You do not have any missed test requests at this time. Keep up the great work!
missedPhotoDetails.confirmation: Your photo was submitted, thanks for letting us know how you are doing!

oneStepReporting.top: No issues and took your medication?
oneStepReporting.complete: to complete your report in one step
oneStepReporting.needHelp: Need help or have an issue?
oneStepReporting.homeScreen: You can also now complete your report for the day from your homescreen by reporting straight from your medication reminder

redoPhoto.title: Resubmit test strip
redoPhoto.subtitle: Review the issue your treatment supporter identified
redoPhoto.explanation: There was an issue with your last test submission and you have been asked to resubmit. Please review the instructions carefully.

testStripInstructions.one: Collect a small amount of urine in a container (about 2 fingers deep)
testStripInstructions.two: Take the test out of the bag
testStripInstructions.three: Dip the strip into the urine for about 2 seconds to the line marked dip. Do not let the test for longer than 2 seconds in the urine.
testStripInstructions.four: Wait 20 minutes for the test to process before proceeding

five.main: Open the application and click "Submit Photo".
five.a: Make sure the photo shows the entire strip, including the barcodes.

testStripInstructions.six: Put the test back in its bag and discard in the trash
